section_path: Section I > A. Conventions for the ICD-10-CM

content.full_text: The conventions for the ICD-10-CM are the general rules for use of the classification independent of the guidelines. These conventions are incorporated within the Alphabetic Index and Tabular List of the ICD-10-CM as instructional notes. (Evidence: pg no: 7, L8-L11)
content.summary: Establishes that ICD-10-CM conventions are general rules independent of guidelines and are incorporated as instructional notes in both the Alphabetic Index and Tabular List (Evidence: pg no: 7, L8-L11)
key_concepts: Conventions are general rules for classification use (Evidence: pg no: 7, L9-L10)
Conventions are independent of guidelines (Evidence: pg no: 7, L10)
Conventions are incorporated as instructional notes (Evidence: pg no: 7, L10-L11)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Conventions are the general rules for use of the classification independent of the guidelines (Evidence: pg no: 7, L9-L10)
detailed_rules.explanation: ICD-10-CM conventions serve as foundational rules that apply to the entire classification system, separate from specific coding guidelines (Evidence: pg no: 7, L9-L10)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Conventions are incorporated within the Alphabetic Index and Tabular List as instructional notes (Evidence: pg no: 7, L10-L11)
detailed_rules.explanation: The conventions appear as instructional notes throughout both major components of ICD-10-CM to guide proper code selection (Evidence: pg no: 7, L10-L11)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Understand that conventions are foundational rules
Step 2: Look for instructional notes in both Alphabetic Index and Tabular List
Step 3: Apply conventions consistently across all code assignments

referenced_by.title: The Alphabetic Index and Tabular List

warnings: Conventions take precedence over guidelines when conflicts arise (Evidence: pg no: 7, L6-L7)
best_practices: Always check for instructional notes in both Index and Tabular List (Evidence: pg no: 7, L10-L11)
common_mistakes: Ignoring instructional notes embedded in the classification
tips: Conventions are foundational - master them before applying specific guidelines
implementation_notes: Conventions apply to all healthcare settings unless otherwise indicated
